III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 05/19/2024 Youth A walked outside and was followed by Staff
1 who had a pocketknife. Staff 1 used the pocketknife to cut Youth
A on both arms. Youth A has two marks on his arms that look like
scratches.
Investigation This complaint was received on 05/23/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 05/23/2024 and
reported they had no additional information.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
05/23/2024. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A has never
expressed any concerns regarding staff or the facility. Foster Care
Worker reported in the past Youth A has attempted to stab staff
with a knife.
Director was interviewed at the facility, on 05/24/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Director was the on-call
administrator on 05/19/2024 and was notified by Supervisor 1 that
Youth A AWOLed around 9:30PM. Director met with Supervisor 1
on 6 Mile Road trying to find Youth A. When Supervisor 1 lost line
of sight, Redford Police were contacted, and a missing person
report was filed (#24-7956). Youth A wears a tether, and Director
contacted the tether monitor company trying to find Youth A.
Director was contacted by the Livonia Police Department stating
they found Youth A attempting to break into the Dollar Store on 6
Mile Road and Inkster. Director went to the Livonia Police
Department and was there with Youth A until 1:00AM, when Youth
A was transported to the Juvenile Detention Center (JDC).
2

Director denied Youth A reported being cut with a pocketknife by
Staff 1 while he was with Youth A at the Livonia Police
Department. Youth A was in JDC for three days and returned to
the facility on 05/22/2024. Director reported a 30-day change of
placement was submitted for Youth A on 03/11/2024, due to
Youth A’s aggressive behavior towards his peers and staff.
Director had daily meetings with Regional Placement Unit (RPU)
and Foster Care Worker (FCW) to discuss possible placement
options for Youth A. Several potential placements have rejected
Youth A due to his aggressive behavior.
An attempt was made to interview Youth A at the facility on
05/24/2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth A
refused to be interviewed and walked out of the conference room.
I did not observe Youth A to have any cuts or injuries on his arms.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 05/30/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 1 recalled the
incident on 05/19/2024 and reported Youth A walked out of the
cottage around 9:00PM. He said all the other youths were already
in their bedroom. Staff 1 asked Youth A “where you are going” and
Youth A replied, “shut the fuck up bitch.” Staff 1 denied using
derogatory language or following Youth A. Staff 1 was the only
staff in the cottage, so he called Supervisor 1 and told him Youth
A AWOLed. Staff 1 denied carrying a pocketknife, following Youth
A outside, or having any physical contact with Youth A. Staff 1
said Youth A has a history of lying about staff when he gets in
trouble. Staff 1 said he avoids engaging with Youth A when he is
escalated because he is very aggressive and lies about staff.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed at the facility on
05/30/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth B
and Youth C reported they were in their bedrooms on 05/19/2024
and did not witness Youth A leaving the cottage. They both denied
seeing Staff 1 carrying a pocketknife. Youth B and Youth C
reported feeling safe and expressed no concerns regarding Staff
1.
The investigation was reassigned to MDHHS Specialist 2, so a
follow up visit was completed at the facility on 06/10/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 2.
An attempt was made to try and interview Youth A on 06/10/2024,
at the facility in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth A
was observed outside running around campus and two staff
members followed him. Youth A approached MDHHS Specialist
3

2’s parked car and started punching the window. Supervisor 2 and
Director tried to verbally redirect Youth A away from the car. Youth
A continued to punch the car windows, then walked to the
administration building and started punching the building.
Supervisor 2 continued to verbally redirect Youth A away from the
building. Supervisor 2 attempted to get Youth A to speak to DCWL
Consultant and MDHHS Specialist 2 outside, but Youth A refused
and told MDHHS Specialist 2, “go fuck yourself you fucking bitch.”
Youth A walked away towards the neighborhood and Supervisor 2
followed behind Youth A on foot.
Director was interviewed at the facility on 06/10/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 2. Director reported Youth
A’s behavior has escalated in the last three days. Youth A has had
15 incident reports since 06/07/2024. Youth A attempted to
tamper with the generators on campus, assaulted staff and
residents, and AWOLed. While at the facility, Law Enforcement
has been contacted due to Youth A’s aggressive behavior and
AWOLing in the neighborhood and knocking on neighbors’ doors.
Law Enforcement picked up Youth A and transported him to the
Children’s Hospital for a mental health evaluation.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 06/20/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 2. Supervisor 1 recalled the
incident and reported on 05/19/2024 he received a phone call
from Staff 1 reporting Youth A AWOLed. Supervisor 1 followed
Youth A on campus until the line of sight was lost. Supervisor 1
contacted the on-call administrator (Director) and filed a police
report. Supervisor 1 reported he didn’t have any contact with
Youth A that evening and is not aware of any concerns regarding
Staff 1 having cut Youth A with a pocketknife.
A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist 2
on 06/21/2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist 2.
Video reviewed:
Video footage from 05/19/2024 at approximately 9:19PM was
reviewed on 05/30/2024, (Note: video has no audio). Youth A is
observed walking towards the entrance door and Staff 1 is
standing in the hallway leading to the sitting room. Youth A left the
cottage and Staff 1 is observed making a phone call and walking
back towards the bedroom area.
4

Documents reviewed:
• Incident reported dated 05/20/2024 completed by Director.
Director was the on-call administrator. Youth A departed
from the cottage. Supervisor 1 followed and notified on-call
administrator. On-call administrator arrived at campus to
assist with search. Supervisor 1 lost line of sight on 6 Mile
Road. Director spoke with Redford Police Department at
9:45PM and filed a police report. Director spoke with tether
company at 10:00PM to verify Youth A’s location. Director
relieved Supervisor 1 search around 10:20PM. Youth A
was picked up by Livonia Police Department for breaking
into a Dollar Store and taken to JDC.
• Youth A’s 30-day change of placement notice dated
03/11/2024. Change of placement letter was submitted due
to Youth A consistently engaging in behaviors that have
and continue to lead to a serious and imminent threat to the
health and safety of Youth A, Staff, and other Youths.
Youth A requires 1:1 Supervision and Youth A continues to
engage in behaviors that put himself, his peers, and the
staff that is working with him in danger.
• Methodist Intervention Standards and Prohibitions Policy
outlines discipline standards for youth. The facility prohibits
any form of corporal punishment and/or inappropriate
hands-on intervention such as but not limited to; pinching,
spanking, slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling
hair, grabbing, pushing, and threatening gestures.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 - no disciplinary action.
• Email received from Chief Administrator on 6/17/2024
stating Youth A has been discharged from the facility and is
currently at the Macomb County Detention Center
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage and documentation
reviewed, there is insufficient evidence to support the allegations
that Staff 1 had a pocketknife or cut Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
5

background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 05/19/2024 Youth A was residing at the facility; Staff 1 told
Youth A to go to their room and used derogatory language.
Investigation Youth A refused to be interviewed. Attempts were made to
interview Youth A at the facility on 05/24/24, 05/30/2024, and
06/10/2024 with MDHHS Specialist 1 and MDHHS Specialist 2.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 05/23/2024 and
reported they had no additional information.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
05/23/2024. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A has never
expressed any concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Staff 1 reported on 05/19/2024 Youth A walked out of the cottage
around 9:00PM. He said all the other youths were already in their
bedroom. Staff 1 asked Youth A where you are going and Youth A
replied, “shut the fuck up bitch.” Staff 1 denied using derogatory
language.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed on 05/30/2024 and they
both denied hearing Staff 1 use derogatory language with Youth A
on 05/19/2024. Youth B and Youth C were in their bedrooms
when Youth A left the cottage. Youth B and Youth C both reported
Youth A uses the “F” word and the “N” word when he does not get
his way. Youth B and Youth C said they have never heard Staff 1
use inappropriate language with them or any other youths.
Documents reviewed:
• Personnel file for Staff 1 - no disciplinary action.
• Methodist Relationship Building Policy: At the heart of
building relationships with young people, staff members
must believe in young people, create an atmosphere of
belonging, and actively engage young people whenever
possible.
1. Young people will be treated with respect at all times i.e.:
a) Referred to by name.
b) They will not be teased or ridiculed regarding personal
features, characteristics, or individual backgrounds (family
members).
c) Staff will not use profanity when addressing young
people, or anytime around young people.
6

Analysis Based on interviews conducted with Staff and Youths, there is
insufficient evidence to support the allegations that Staff 1 used
derogatory language with Youth A. Youths interviewed reported
Youth A is the one that uses inappropriate language with staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
